PAL.NAME: Microsoft Lync Server 2010 - Front End
PAL.DESCRIPTION: Performance counter thresholds for Microsoft Lync Server 2010 Front End Server.

ANALYSIS.NAME: LS:USrv - 01 - DBStore\USrv - 002 - Queue Latency USrv - 002 - Queue Latency (msec)
ANALYSIS.DESCRIPTION:
Queue latency is the amount of time (in milliseconds) that it takes for a request to leave the Front End Server's queue toward the back-end database.
If this value by itself is high, you may have be encountering a network problem between FE->SQL.
If this value is high and Sproc Latency is high, it is most commonly a bottom-neck with the SQL backend.
Spikes are to be expected during peak hours.

ANALYSIS.NAME: LS:USrv - 01 - DBStore\USrv - 004 - Sproc Latency USrv - 004 - Sproc Latency (msec)
ANALYSIS.DESCRIPTION:
Sproc latency is the amount of time (in milliseconds) that it takes for the database to process the request. This performance value is collected from the time the request leaves the Front End Server queue until that the request returns.
If this value by itself is high, it is likely a bottleneck with the SQL backend.
Spikes are to be expected during peak hours.

ANALYSIS.NAME: LS:USrv - 01 - DBStore USrv - 020 - Throttled requests/sec
ANALYSIS.DESCRIPTION:
The number of requests that were rejected/sec with a retry-after since the database queue latency was high.
A healthy environment should never throttle requests, this value must not exceed 0.

ANALYSIS.NAME: LS:SIP - 01 - Peers SIP - 019 - Sends Timed-Out/sec
ANALYSIS.DESCRIPTION: The per-second rate of sends dropped because they stayed in outgoing (send) queue for too long.

ANALYSIS.NAME: LS:SIP - 01 - Peers SIP - 020 - Average Outgoing Queue Delay
ANALYSIS.DESCRIPTION: The average time (in seconds) the messages delayed in outgoing (send) queues.

ANALYSIS.NAME: LS:SIP - 01 - Peers SIP - 023 - Flow-controlled Connections
ANALYSIS.DESCRIPTION: The number of connections that are currently being flow-controlled (no socket receives are posted).

ANALYSIS.NAME: LS:SIP - 02 - Protocol SIP - 005 - Incoming Requests Dropped/sec
ANALYSIS.DESCRIPTION: The per-second rate of incoming requests dropped because they could not be processed (due to bad headers, insufficient routing information, server resource allocation failure).

ANALYSIS.NAME: LS:SIP - 02 - Protocol SIP - 009 - Incoming Responses Dropped/sec
ANALYSIS.DESCRIPTION: The per-second rate of incoming responses dropped because they could not be processed (due to bad headers, insufficient routing information, server resource allocation failure).

ANALYSIS.NAME: LS:SIP - 02 - Protocol SIP - 021 - Average Incoming Message Processing Time
ANALYSIS.PRIMARYDATASOURCE: \LS:SIP - 02 - Protocol\SIP - 021 - Average Incoming Message Processing Time
ANALYSIS.DESCRIPTION: The average time (in seconds) it takes to process an incoming message.

DATASOURCE.NAME: \LS:SIP - 02 - Protocol\SIP - 021 - Average Incoming Message Processing Time
DATASOURCE.EXPRESSIONPATH: \LS:SIP - 02 - Protocol\SIP - 021 - Average Incoming Message Processing Time

CHART.CHARTTITLE: \LS:SIP - 02 - Protocol\SIP - 021 - Average Incoming Message Processing Time
CHART.DATASOURCE: \LS:SIP - 02 - Protocol\SIP - 021 - Average Incoming Message Processing Time

ANALYSIS.NAME: LS:SIP - 04 - Responses SIP - 055 - Local 503 Responses/sec
ANALYSIS.DESCRIPTION: The per-second rate of 503 responses generated by the server.

ANALYSIS.NAME: LS:SIP - 06 - Authentication SIP - 031 - Authentication System Errors/sec
ANALYSIS.DESCRIPTION: The per-second rate of authentication failures caused by system errors (due to low memory conditions or otherwise).

ANALYSIS.NAME: LS:SIP - 07 - Load Management SIP - 000 - Average Holding Time For Incoming Messages
ANALYSIS.PRIMARYDATASOURCE: \LS:SIP - 07 - Load Management\SIP - 000 - Average Holding Time For Incoming Messages
ANALYSIS.DESCRIPTION: The average time that the server held the incoming messages currently being processed.

DATASOURCE.NAME: \LS:SIP - 07 - Load Management\SIP - 000 - Average Holding Time For Incoming Messages
DATASOURCE.EXPRESSIONPATH: \LS:SIP - 07 - Load Management\SIP - 000 - Average Holding Time For Incoming Messages

CHART.CHARTTITLE: \LS:SIP - 07 - Load Management\SIP - 000 - Average Holding Time For Incoming Messages
CHART.DATASOURCE: \LS:SIP - 07 - Load Management\SIP - 000 - Average Holding Time For Incoming Messages

THRESHOLD.NAME: Average Holding Time For Incoming Messages >= 1

ANALYSIS.NAME: LS:SIP - 07 - Load Management SIP - 006 - Incoming Messages Timed out
ANALYSIS.PRIMARYDATASOURCE: \LS:SIP - 07 - Load Management\SIP - 006 - Incoming Messages Timed out

DATASOURCE.NAME: \LS:SIP - 07 - Load Management\SIP - 006 - Incoming Messages Timed out
DATASOURCE.EXPRESSIONPATH: \LS:SIP - 07 - Load Management\SIP - 006 - Incoming Messages Timed out

CHART.CHARTTITLE: \LS:SIP - 07 - Load Management\SIP - 006 - Incoming Messages Timed out
CHART.DATASOURCE: \LS:SIP - 07 - Load Management\SIP - 006 - Incoming Messages Timed out

ANALYSIS.DESCRIPTION: The number of incoming messages currently being held by the server for processing for more than the maximum tracking interval.

ANALYSIS.NAME: LS:ImMcu - 02 - MCU Health And Performance IMMCU - 005 - MCU Health State
ANALYSIS.PRIMARYDATASOURCE: \LS:ImMcu - 02 - MCU Health And Performance\IMMCU - 005 - MCU Health State
ANALYSIS.DESCRIPTION: The current health of the MCU. 0 = Normal. 1 = Loaded. 2 = Full. 3 = Unavailable.

ANALYSIS.NAME: LS:ImMcu - 00 - IMMcu Conferences IMMCU - 020 - Throttled Sip Connections
ANALYSIS.DESCRIPTION:
The number of throttled SIP connections.
This can be an early indicator of IMMCU health.

ANALYSIS.NAME: LS:DATAMCU - 04 - MCU Health And Performance DATAMCU - 005 - MCU Health State
ANALYSIS.PRIMARYDATASOURCE: \LS:DATAMCU - 04 - MCU Health And Performance\DATAMCU - 005 - MCU Health State
ANALYSIS.DESCRIPTION: The current health of the MCU. 0 = Normal. 1 = Loaded. 2 = Full. 3 = Unavailable.

ANALYSIS.PRIMARYDATASOURCE: \LS:AVMCU - 04 - MCU Health And Performance\AVMCU - 005 - MCU Health State

The current health of the MCU. 0 = Normal. 1 = Loaded. 2 = Full. 3 = Unavailable.

ANALYSIS.NAME: LS:AsMcu - 01 - MCU Health And Performance ASMCU - 005 - MCU Health State
ANALYSIS.PRIMARYDATASOURCE: \LS:AsMcu - 01 - MCU Health And Performance\ASMCU - 005 - MCU Health State
ANALYSIS.DESCRIPTION: The current health of the MCU. 0 = Normal. 1 = Loaded. 2 = Full. 3 = Unavailable.

ANALYSIS.DESCRIPTION: The number of requests rejected because the application request queue was full.

ANALYSIS.NAME: LS:CAA - 00 - Operations CAA - 000 - Incomplete calls per sec
ANALYSIS.DESCRIPTION: The per second rate of incomplete calls to Conferencing Attendant. This includes calls disconnected by the user and by the system due to invalid conference id, passcode, etc.

ANALYSIS.NAME: LS:USrv - 26 - Conference Mcu Allocator\USrv - 021 - Allocation Latency USrv - 021 - Allocation Latency (msec)
ANALYSIS.DESCRIPTION: The average time (in milliseconds) taken to complete a full Mcu allocation request.

ANALYSIS.NAME: LS:Mcx - 00 - Mobile Communication Service MCX - 031 - Push Notification Requests Failed/Second
ANALYSIS.PRIMARYDATASOURCE: \LS:Mcx - 00 - Mobile Communication Service\MCX - 031 - Push Notification Requests Failed/Second

DATASOURCE.EXPRESSIONPATH: \LS:Mcx - 00 - Mobile Communication Service\MCX - 031 - Push Notification Requests Failed/Second

CHART.CHARTTITLE: \LS:Mcx - 00 - Mobile Communication Service\MCX - 031 - Push Notification Requests Failed/Second
CHART.DATASOURCE: \LS:Mcx - 00 - Mobile Communication Service\MCX - 031 - Push Notification Requests Failed/Second

ANALYSIS.DESCRIPTION:
The per-second rate of push notifications failure.
This is an indicator of the Push Service health, not Front End Server health.

ANALYSIS.NAME: LS:Mcx - 00 - Mobile Communication Service MCX - 029 - Push Notification Requests Throttled/Second
ANALYSIS.PRIMARYDATASOURCE: \LS:Mcx - 00 - Mobile Communication Service\MCX - 029 - Push Notification Requests Throttled/Second

ANALYSIS.DESCRIPTION: The per-second rate of push notifications throttling

ANALYSIS.NAME: LS:Mcx - 00 - Mobile Communication Service MCX - 011 - Requests Rejected/Second
ANALYSIS.DESCRIPTION: The per-second rate of requests rejected

ANALYSIS.NAME: LS:Mcx - 00 - Mobile Communication Service MCX - 015 - Requests Failed/Second
ANALYSIS.DESCRIPTION: The per-second rate of requests failed.

ANALYSIS.NAME: MSSQL$RTC:Buffer Manager Page life expectancy
ANALYSIS.DESCRIPTION: Avg. in seconds how long SQL Server expects a data page to stay in cache. The target is at least 300 (5 min). When under 300, this may indicate a potential shortage of memory.

ANALYSIS.NAME: MSSQL$RTC:Memory Manager\Total Server Memory Total Server Memory (KB)
ANALYSIS.DESCRIPTION: Shows the amount of memory that SQL Server is currently using. This value should grow until its equal to Target Server Memory, as it populates its caches and loads pages into memory.

ANALYSIS.NAME: MSSQL$RTC:Memory Manager\Target Server Memory Target Server Memory (KB)
ANALYSIS.DESCRIPTION: Shows the amount of memory that SQL Server wants to use based on the configured Max Server Memory. It represents the ideal number of pages in the buffer pool. It is the amount of memory that can be committed without causing paging.

ANALYSIS.NAME: MSSQL$RTC:Memory Manager Memory Grants Pending
ANALYSIS.DESCRIPTION: Total number of processes per second waiting for a workspace memory grant. Numbers higher than 0 indicate a lack of memory.

ANALYSIS.NAME: MSSQL$RTC:SQL Statistics Batch Requests/sec
ANALYSIS.DESCRIPTION: Number of batch requests received per second, and is a good general indicator for the activity level of the SQL Server.

ANALYSIS.NAME: MSSQL$RTCLOCAL:Buffer Manager Page life expectancy
ANALYSIS.DESCRIPTION: Avg. in seconds how long SQL Server expects a data page to stay in cache. The target is at least 300 (5 min). When under 300, this may indicate a potential shortage of memory.

ANALYSIS.NAME: MSSQL$RTCLOCAL:Memory Manager\Total Server Memory Total Server Memory (KB)
ANALYSIS.DESCRIPTION: Shows the amount of memory that SQL Server is currently using. This value should grow until its equal to Target Server Memory, as it populates its caches and loads pages into memory.

ANALYSIS.NAME: MSSQL$RTCLOCAL:Memory Manager\Target Server Memory Target Server Memory (KB)
ANALYSIS.DESCRIPTION: Shows the amount of memory that SQL Server wants to use based on the configured Max Server Memory. It represents the ideal number of pages in the buffer pool. It is the amount of memory that can be committed without causing paging.

ANALYSIS.NAME: MSSQL$RTCLOCAL:Memory Manager Memory Grants Pending
ANALYSIS.DESCRIPTION: Total number of processes per second waiting for a workspace memory grant. Numbers higher than 0 indicate a lack of memory.

ANALYSIS.NAME: MSSQL$RTCLOCAL:SQL Statistics Batch Requests/sec
ANALYSIS.DESCRIPTION: Number of batch requests received per second, and is a good general indicator for the activity level of the SQL Server.
